significance: Power and limits of artistic expression
Grief that transcends life and death boundaries
description: The tragic tale of Orpheus, the legendary musician whose songs could charm all living things and even stones. When his beloved wife Eurydice dies from a serpent bite, Orpheus descends to the underworld and uses his music to convince Hades and Persephone to let her return. They agree on one condition: he must not look back at her until they reach the upper world. At the last moment, Orpheus glances back, and Eurydice vanishes forever.

philosophicalMeaning.forbiddenGaze: Universal motif of prohibited looking - curiosity and lack of faith destroy
philosophicalMeaning.humanLimitation: Even the greatest gifts cannot overcome fundamental limits (mortality, doubt)
philosophicalMeaning.coreTheme: The fatal power of doubt and the impossibility of reversing death
philosophicalMeaning.artisticPower: Music and art as forces that transcend normal boundaries, even death itself

name: Greek Mythology
relatedConcepts: Izanagi's Journey to Yomi - Similar failed rescue
